questions.question: 1. B-H curve is also known as ______.

explanations.a: Incorrect, The Curie point refers to the temperature above which a material loses its magnetic properties.
explanations.b: Incorrect, Open circuit characteristics relate to the behavior of electrical circuits, not magnetic materials.
explanations.c: Incorrect, While the hysteresis loop is part of the B-H curve, it does not fully define it.
explanations.d: Correct! The B-H curve or magnetization curve illustrates the relationship between flux density (B) and magnetizing force (H). Refer here for more information.

questions.question: 2. The area of the hysteresis loop represents ______.

explanations.a: Incorrect, Coercivity measures the field strength required to reduce magnetization to zero, not energy loss.
explanations.b: Incorrect, Remanence is the residual magnetization when the field is removed.
explanations.c: Correct! The enclosed area is proportional to the energy dissipated as heat per cycle of magnetization.
explanations.d: Incorrect, Magnetic permeability measures how easily a material supports the formation of a magnetic field.

answers.b: The residual flux density when H = 0
answers.c: The magnetizing force required to bring B to zero
answers.d: The energy dissipated as heat during magnetization

explanations.a: Incorrect, Maximum flux density is known as saturation.
explanations.b: Incorrect, Residual flux density is called remanence (Br).
explanations.c: Correct! Coercivity is the magnetizing force needed to demagnetize the material.
explanations.d: Incorrect, Energy loss during magnetization is related to hysteresis loss.

questions.question: 4. What is the unit of magnetic flux density (B)?

explanations.a: Incorrect, Weber measures total magnetic flux, not flux density.
explanations.b: Correct! Tesla measures flux density, which is magnetic flux per unit area.
explanations.c: Incorrect, Amperes per meter is the unit for magnetizing force (H).
explanations.d: Incorrect, Henry measures inductance, unrelated to flux density.

questions.question: 5. What is remanence (Br) in the B-H curve?

answers.b: The force required to saturate the material

explanations.a: Correct! Remanence represents the residual magnetization after removing the applied field.
explanations.c: Incorrect, Energy lost per cycle is hysteresis loss.
explanations.d: Incorrect, Resistance to magnetization refers to permeability.
